characters: OH GOOD, THE COPS. SHE WEN DAAAWAY

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: “INSERT COIN” blinks on the menu screen of FIX-IT FELIX, We hear a coin being deposited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WRECK-IT RALPH is asleep inside his stump. A voice-over k in, sounding more like a confessional than a traditional

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: My name’s Ralph, and I’m a Bad Guy. I’m 9 feet tall. I weigh 643 pounds. Got a little bit of a temper on me. You know, my passions bubble very near the surface, not gonna lie. A bulldozer removes Ralph and the stump. Ralph’s head pop out of the stump.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (ON-SCREEN)
dialogues.text: Hey, you moved my stump!

dialogues.speaker: ARRRGGHHHHHH
dialogues.text: Ralph throws a bit of a tantrum. The NICELAND APARTMENTS are constructed where the stump w

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Anyhoo, what else? I’m a wrecker. I wreck -- professionally. Ralph appears on screen in front of the Niceland Apartmen RALPH (ON-SCREEN) (CONT’D) I’M GONNA WRECK IT! Ralph wrecks the building. He throws a Nicelander.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I’m very good at what I do. Probably the best I know.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Thing is, fixing is the name of the game. Literally, figuratively, meta... physically... FIX-IT FELIX arrives and starts fixing.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So yeah, naturally the guy with the name Fix-it Felix is the good guy. He’s nice enough as good guys go. Definitely fixes stuff really well. But if you've got a magic hammer from your father, how hard can it be...?

dialogues.speaker: YOO-HOO
dialogues.text: MARY pops up in a window with a pie. Felix eats the pie, a protective hard-hat appears on his head.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: I guarantee you if he had a standard issue hammer like the kind you'd get at the hardware store-- he would not be able to fix the things I wreck as quickly. The damage is repaired. The screen reads “YOU FIXED IT!”

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: When Felix does a good job, he gets a medal. A Nicelander places a little medal around Felix’s neck an gives him a peck on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Are there medals for the sweet science of wrecking? To that I say, “Ha.” The Nicelanders pick up Ralph and thrown him off the roof

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Ahhhhhhhh! He lands on the ground in the mud. KER-PLUNK.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: .--- And no, there are not. We pull back from the game console. We’re in... LITWAK’S FAMILY FUN CENTER The place is bustling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHIRON: “30 YEARS AGO.”

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It’s not like I’m complaining. Well, it’s a little like I’m complaining. But I get it. I been doing this long enough to know a steady arcade gig’s nothing to sneeze at. TIME LAPSE -- The arcade expands over the years. Games ge wheeled out. New games get wheeled in. Owner LARRY LITWAK takes real good care of the place through the years.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Seen a lotta games come and go. I think about all those guys from Asteroids? Boom! Gone. Centipede? Who knows where that guy is. No, I know I’m very lucky. CHIRON: “TODAY”

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It’s just after so many years, it becomes kind of hard to love your job when no one seems to like you for doing it. The arcade is older now, and all the games are more moder giant first-person shooter game gets wheeled in. The arca closes. The “Open” sign shuts off. The Dance Dance Revolution screen is visible in the background. On it we see a cycle of the dancer dancing. T dancer suddenly stops, peeks toward the darkened “Open” s INSET THE GAME: The dancer relaxes.

dialogues.speaker: DANCER
dialogues.text: (calling out) THAT’S IT! ARCADE’S CLOSED! She and her back-up dancers limp off, rubbing their shoulders, limping, stretching after a long day of dancin INSET STREET FIGHTER GAME CONSOLE: Two fighters, RYU and stop beating each other.

dialogues.speaker: RYU
dialogues.text: What a day. Want to head to Tappers, Ken?

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: If you’re buying, buddy. They put their arms around each other and walk off screen BACK ON THE FIX-IT FELIX CONSOLE: Felix and the Nicelande are on the roof.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Quittin’ time! We push through the game screen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The game is now in hyper-realistic 3-D.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Good job, everyone! Felix and the Nicelanders exit the roof as we pan down th building and get a sense of the world.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I dunno, maybe I wouldn’t be feeling this way if things were different after work. But as it is, Felix and the Nicelanders go hang out in their homes-- which he’s just fixed. Ralph picks himself up from the mud. He watches sadly as Nicelanders ignore him and carry Felix to the penthouse.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And I head off to the pile of garbage in the dump... where I live. You might call it a lonely cesspit of despair on the outskirts of humanity...which would be accurate. But I call it home. Ralph climbs up the brick pile he calls home.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I guess I can’t bellyache too much; I got my bricks. I got my stump. He pummels the bricks into dust and pulls a pile of brick over him like a blanket. He stares longingly at the build

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It looks uncomfortable, but it’s actually fine. I’m good. CLOSE ON: Ralph, who sighs a very long sigh.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But... if I’m really honest with myself, I see Felix up there, getting pies all the time, acting like Captain Fancy. And sometimes I think... RALPH’S POV: Through the penthouse windows, he can see Fe being ushered over by the Nicelanders to a dinner table f of delicious, warm entrées. CLOSE ON RALPH: As he speaks out-loud.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Man, it must be nice being the good guy. Applause. Pull back to reveal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph sits in a room full of VIDEO GAME BAD GUYS. A sign the wall reads: “BadAnon: One Game at a Time."

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: Nice share, Ralph. As fellow Bad Guys, we've all felt what you’re feeling, and we've come to terms with it.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: ZANGIEF
dialogues.text: (thick Russian accent) Right here. I am Zangief. I am Bad Guy.

dialogues.speaker: OTHER BAD GUYS
dialogues.text: Hi Zangief.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Hi Zangief.

dialogues.speaker: ZANGIEF
dialogues.text: I relate to you, Ralph. When I hit bottom, I was crushing man’s skull (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: ZANGIEF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: like sparrow egg between my thighs. (smacking his thigh) And I am wondering, why do you have to be so bad, Zangief? Why can’t more like good guy? Then I have moment of clarity: If Zangief is good guy, who will crush man’s skull like sparrow egg between thighs? And I say, “Zangief, you are bad guy. But this does not mean you are bad guy.” Claps of understanding.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Right. I’m sorry, you lost me there.

dialogues.speaker: ZOMBIE
dialogues.text: (thick Zombie accent) Arrhh. Zombie. Bad Guy.

dialogues.speaker: OTHER BAD GUYS
dialogues.text: Hi Zombie.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Hi Zombie.

dialogues.speaker: ZOMBIE
dialogues.text: Zangief saying: labels not make you happy -- good, bad... (Frankenstein growl) You must love you.

dialogues.speaker: CY-BORG
dialogues.text: Yeah! Inside HERE! Cy-borg rips out Zombie’s heart, shows it to Ralph.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Okay. I gotcha. Watch out; it’s dripping.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: Question Ralph: we’ve been asking you to BadAnon for years now, and tonight you finally show up. Why is that?

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: I don’t know, I just felt like coming.... I suppose it has something to do with the fact that, (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: well, today is 30th Anniversary of my game.

dialogues.speaker: SATAN
dialogues.text: Happy Anniversary, Ralph.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Thanks, Satan.

dialogues.speaker: SATAN
dialogues.text: It’s sai-tine, actually.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Got it. But here’s the thing... (exhales, then) I don’t want to be the bad guy anymore. GASPS. Bowser spits out his coffee and thus fire.

dialogues.speaker: CY-BORG
dialogues.text: You can’t mess with the program, Ralph.

dialogues.speaker: M. BISON
dialogues.text: (miming “crazy” ) You're not going Turbo, are you?

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Turbo? No, I’m not going Turbo. Come on guys. Is it Turbo to want a friend, or a medal, or a piece of pie every once in a while? Is it turbo to want more out of life?

dialogues.speaker: ZOMBIE
dialogues.text: Yeeeeesssss.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: Ralph, Ralph, we get it. But we can’t change who we are, and the sooner you accept that the better off your game and your life will be.

dialogues.speaker: ZANGIEF
dialogues.text: Hey, one game at a time, Ralph.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: Now let’s close out with the Bad Guy Affirmation. They all get up, hold hands.

dialogues.speaker: ALL BAD GUYS
dialogues.text: I’m bad. And that’s good. I will never be good. And that’s not bad. There’s no one I’d rather be than me. Ralph doesn’t say the Affirmation. His eyes are wide open non-believer. The TITLE burns in over Ralph:

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: Okay gang, see you next week. The bad guys break the circle. Satan puts a supportive ha on Ralph’s back.

dialogues.speaker: SATAN
dialogues.text: Hang in there, Ralph.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: Hey Zombie, don’t forget your hatchets. We pull out to see that the meeting was held in the cente room of Pac-Man. Ralph filches two cherries and catches u with the others.

dialogues.speaker: TUNNEL TO GAME CENTRAL STATION
dialogues.text: The bad guys climb onto a train car and shove off down th tracks. Ralph sits on the back with the cherries. INT. LITWAK’S FAMILY FUNLAND - NIGHT We follow the trail of the train through the power cord o the Pac-Man game to the power strip.

dialogues.speaker: TUNNEL TO GAME CENTRAL STATION
dialogues.text: The characters hop off the cart and make their way into..

dialogues.speaker: GAME CENTRAL STATION
dialogues.text: ...a huge open concourse full of VIDEO GAME CHARACTERS bustling about.

dialogues.speaker: GRAND CENTRAL ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, please do not leave personal items unattended. Unattended items will be confiscated. Report any suspicious activity to the Surge Protector. Last call for Tapper wagon, departing in outlet two. Tapper wagon, last call. Soul train to Dance Dance Revolution now boarding in outlet twelve. All aboard the Soul Train, outlet twelve. Ralph passes through the entrance, and a rent-a-cop, SURG PROTECTOR, appears out of nowhere. A buzzer sounds.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Ugh.

dialogues.speaker: SURGE PROTECTOR
dialogues.text: Step aside, sir, random security check.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Random my behind. You always stop me.

dialogues.speaker: SURGE PROTECTOR
dialogues.text: I’m just a surge protector doing my job, sir. Name...

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Lara Croft.

dialogues.speaker: SURGE PROTECTOR
dialogues.text: Name...

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Wreck-it Ralph.

dialogues.speaker: SURGE PROTECTOR
dialogues.text: And where you coming from?

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Pac-Man.

dialogues.speaker: SURGE PROTECTOR
dialogues.text: Ya bring any fruit with you? Ralph hides the cherries behind his back.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Uh... No, no. No fruit.

dialogues.speaker: SURGE PROTECTOR
dialogues.text: Okay then. Where you heading?

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Fix-it Felix, Jr.

dialogues.speaker: SURGE PROTECTOR
dialogues.text: Anything to declare?

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: I hate you.

dialogues.speaker: SURGE PROTECTOR
dialogues.text: I get that a lot. Proceed. As Ralph walks through the console. People move out of hi way and whisper things like, “Bad Guy.” “Watch out.”

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL KID
dialogues.text: (whispering) Bad guy coming! He passes a screen displaying a PSA video narrated by Son

dialogues.speaker: SONIC
dialogues.text: If you leave your game, stay safe. Stay alert. And whatever you do...don’t die. Because if you die outside your own game...you don’t regenerate. Ever. Game over. Ralph comes upon a group of homeless characters, Q*Bert amongst them, who hold a sign: “Out of Order. Please Help Ralph hands Q*Bert a cherry.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Here you go buddy. It’s fresh. Straight from Pac-Man’s. Hang in there guys. He approaches the entrance to the Fix-It Felix portal. Th buzzer sounds and Surge Protector appears.

dialogues.speaker: SURGE PROTECTOR
dialogues.text: Name?

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Argh!

dialogues.speaker: A RAGING PARTY
dialogues.text: In a gorgeous penthouse. Disco lights spin. Nicelanders d and drink. SKRILLEX DJs. Felix passes out hors d'oeuvres.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph arrives on the trolley. CRACK! SIZZLE! Ralph looks up just as “WE LOVE YOU FELIX” fireworks burst over the Niceland apartments. Huh? He digs two bottles out of the trash. He uses them as binoculars, and aims them at the penthouse... THROUGH BINOCULARS: it’s a rockin’ party.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Happy thirtieth anniversary? They're having a party without me? There are ice sculptures and dancing and a giant buffet table. Eating his way across the table is PAC-MAN.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Pac-Man! They invited Pac-Man? That cherry-chasing, dot-muncher isn’t even part of this game! He slams the bottles down. They shatter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix struts through the room, happy and proud.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: Great party, Felix.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Why thank you, friend.

dialogues.speaker: DEANNA
dialogues.text: Felix, you're needed on the dance floor. Deanna drags him onto a colorful dance floor. Felix does Fix-it Hammer dance. Everyone follows along. The door bell RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: I'll bet that’s Mario, fashionably late, per the norm.

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: I'll get it, Felix. Gene dances to the door and opens it. A smiling Ralph fil the door frame. Gene GASPS and slams the door.

dialogues.speaker: GENE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s Ralph! MURMURS of shock and confusion.

dialogues.speaker: NORWOOD
dialogues.text: He’1ll wreck the party.

dialogues.speaker: DEANNA
dialogues.text: Hide the stemware.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: Get rid of him, Felix.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Oh, right. I’1l go talk to him. Carry on everyone. Felix pulls out his hammer and heads out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph still stands at the door. Felix slips out.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Ralph? Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Hey Felix, I just wanted to check on you. I saw a big explosion or something go over the building there--

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Oh, those were just fireworks.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Fireworks. Okay. Is it somebody's birthday or...?

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Well, it’s more of an anniversary. The thirtieth anniversary of our game, actually.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: What? Is that today?

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: I know!

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: I’m such a dummy with dates. Anyway, congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Thank you, Ralph. And to you, too. Awkward silence. Finally, the door opens. A Frogger TURTL sticks his head out.

dialogues.speaker: TURTLE
dialogues.text: Just a heads up, Felix, they're bringing out the cake in a few shakes.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Hi, Glen.

dialogues.speaker: TURTLE
dialogues.text: (terse) Ralph. Turtle shuts the door, fast.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Cake. Heard about this cake stuff. Never had it. No one ever seems to throw it out, so it never ends up in the dump. Never actually tasted it.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: ...yeah.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Always wanted to try cake.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: (shaking his head, no) I don’t suppose you'd like to come in and have a slice, would you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph throws the door open and pushes Felix inside.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Hey-oh, everybody! Ralph’s head slams into the ceiling. A large chunks falls down on Felix YELPS! Felix drops DEAD. Everyone GASPS in horror. A little flower floats above Fe and we hear a quick cycle of DEATH MUSIC. Felix suddenly regenerates next to Ralph.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: I’m okay. I’m okay. Fit as a fiddle.... Now, you all know Ralph.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Evening...oops. (breaking the steps) Evening Nel. Lucy. Don. Dana.

dialogues.speaker: DEANNA
dialogues.text: Deanna.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Big Gene.

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: (to Felix, annoyed) Why is HE here?

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: He’s just here for a slice of cake.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: And I am a big part of the game, technically speaking... Why are you here, Gene? Ralph bends down and he and Gene face off. Felix steps between them, breaking it up.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Oh look, the cake. Mary wheels out an elaborate cake of the Niceland apartme building, complete with “We Love Felix” candy fireworks.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, I’1l be dipped; you've really outdone yourself, Mary. The Nicelanders gather around the cake and HAIL PRAISE.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: Oh and look; there’s all of us at the top. Ralph approaches and looks over the cake. INSET CAKE: A little Felix stands on the roof, reaching f medal, surrounded lovingly by Nicelanders. But there’s no sign of Ralph.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Each apartment is everyone's favorite flavor. Norwood’s is red velvet.

dialogues.speaker: NORWOOD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Guilty!

dialogues.speaker: MARY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lemon for Lucy. Rum cake for gene, and for Felix-- Ralph looks for his figurine, and finds himself in the mu looking like some sort of deranged troll. His face sinks.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Hey Mary, what’s the flavor of that mud that I’m stuck in there?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Hmm? Oh, chocolate.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Never been real fond of chocolate.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Well, I did not know that.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: One other little thing — I hate to be picky but — this angry little guy might be a lot happier if you put him up here with everyone else. Ralph picks up the little Ralph figurine. He puts him on roof, smooshing the cake a little.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: My cake. Ralph pushes an ugly smile onto his figurine’s face.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: See that? Look at that smile.

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: No, no, no. You see, Ralph, there’s no room for you up here. Gene knocks Little Ralph back into the mud.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Well, what about this? We can make room. We can take turns. Easy. Ralph puts Little Ralph back on top of the cake and slams Little Felix into the mud instead. The Nicelanders GASP.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: How about we just eat the cake!

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: Hang on. Felix needs to be on the roof, because he’s about to get his medal.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Well, then how about we just take that medal and give it to Ralph for once. Would that be the end of the world, Gene? Ralph rips the medal off, breaking the delicate fireworks and puts it on little Ralph.

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: Now you’re just being ridiculous; only good guys win medals, and you sir are no good guy.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: I could be a good guy if I wanted to, and I could win a medal.

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. And when you do, come and talk to us. Gene takes Ralph off the cake.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: And then would you finally let me be on the top of the cake with you guys?

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: If you won a medal, we’d let you live up here in the penthouse.... (off Ralph’s look) But it will never happen... Gene rips the medal off little Ralph, puts it on little Felix, and puts Felix back on the top. GENE (CONT’D) ..-because you’re just the bad guy who wrecks the building.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: No, I'm not. Gene slams Little Ralph back in the mud upside down.

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: Yes, you are.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: No, I’m NOT! Ralph slams his fist down right on the cake. SMASH! Chunk cake and frosting cover the Nicelanders. Pac-Man stops eating. His mouth falls open in shock.

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: Yes, you are.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: All right, Gene, you know what? I’m gonna win a medal. Oh I am gonna win a medal! The shiniest medal this place has ever seen. A medal so good that it will make Felix’s medals wet their pants! And good night. Thank you for the party. Ralph exits, smashing a hole in the other side of the doo

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: Is he serious?

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: Oh please, where is a Bad Guy gonna win a medal? Of course he’s not serious.

dialogues.speaker: SLAM CUT TO
dialogues.text: RALPH’S HAND CATCHING A BEER. We're in a bar.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: I’ve never been more serious about anything in my life. That’s why I came straight here, Tapper. TAPPER the bartender collects the empties in front or Ral

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You've never given me a bum steer. Now, where can a guy like me go and win a medal?

dialogues.speaker: TAPPER
dialogues.text: I don’t think such a game exists, Ralph.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Come on, you know people. There’s got to be--

dialogues.speaker: MAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Tapper! Need a root beer!

dialogues.speaker: TAPPER
dialogues.text: (to Ralph) Hold that thought. Tapper runs off. OUTSIDE THE GAME CONSOLE: we watch the 8-bit view of the Beer Tapper game as Tapper zips down a row of bars, slidi beers to other customers. BACK INSIDE THE GAME: Tapper returns to Ralph’s side.

dialogues.speaker: TAPPER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You were saying.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: I was saying, I can’t spend another thirty years living alone in the (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: garbage. I’m not going back without a medal.

dialogues.speaker: TAPPER
dialogues.text: Well, I don’t know what to tell you. Maybe somebody left a medal here. You're welcome to dig through the lost and found.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph digs through the “lost and found” crate. Behind him see a hallway with the saloon doors on one side and restr on the other.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Okay let’s see what we’ve got here. Ralph rummages through the box. A little cockroach scurri out of the box. Ralph SHOOS it.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shoo. Shoo. Go. (back rummaging) Mushroom. No.... What is this? No. (picking up a pair of red briefs) Oh come on Zangief. Gross. Ralph sighs, pushes the crate back into the closet, sighs

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What am I doing? Just then, a heavily-armored space marine enters through saloon doors and bumps into Ralph.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, excuse you. The marine staggers on and right into the wall again and again, in a walk cycle. Meet PVT. MARKOWSKI.

dialogues.speaker: MARKOWSKI
dialogues.text: (mumbling, shell-shocked) We are humanity’s last hope. Our mission, destroy all cy-bugs. We are humanity’s last hope-- Ralph stands and looks at him, curious.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: You okay there, cadet? Markowski whips around quickly and grabs Ralph by the col

dialogues.speaker: MARKOWSKI
dialogues.text: We've only been plugged in a week. And every day it’s climb the building. Fight bugs. Climb the building. Fight more bugs. Ralph pries Markowski’s hands off of his collar.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Yeah yeah yeah, right. Hey, easy on the overalls spaceman. It’s tough all over. Ralph heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: MARKOWSKI
dialogues.text: And all for what? A lousy medal.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Medal? You win a medal?

dialogues.speaker: MARKOWSKI
dialogues.text: Yeah. Medal of Heroes.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Ooooh. Is it shiny?

dialogues.speaker: MARKOWSKI
dialogues.text: Pretty shiny.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Ooooh. And it says Hero on it?

dialogues.speaker: MARKOWSKI
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: And you said you win it by climbing a building?

dialogues.speaker: MARKOWSKI
dialogues.text: ..-And fighting bugs.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Right. Bugs. Listen: Is there any chance I could go with you to your game and get one of those medals--

dialogues.speaker: MARKOWSKI
dialogues.text: Negatory.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Does that mean maybe?

dialogues.speaker: MARKOWSKI
dialogues.text: No. Look, only the bravest and the best serve in our corps-- The little cockroach climbs up the wall beside him. Marko sees it and squeals like a little baby.

dialogues.speaker: BUG
dialogues.text: He goes to run away. But slams into the wall and passes o Ralph looks down at him and gets an idea. INT. BROOM CLOSET — MOMENTS LATER We see Markowski passed out in his skivvies. An armored f kicks Markowski’s leg in, slams the door, and breaks off door handle. It’s Ralph in Markowski’s armor, his gut hanging out. He SUCKS in his breath, PULLS UP his pants. Breathes a sigh relief. His gut pops back out.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The arcade will open in fifteen minutes. Please report to your games. A clumsy armored RALPH steps out of the Tapper’s entrance

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: (to himself) Okay, what was it called? Hero- Hero something. Hero’s...Duty! Hero’s Duty. He sees soldiers in the same uniform going into a game ca HERO'S DUTY. He follows. He trips over Q*Bert.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: (flipping up the visor) Sorry Q*Bert. It’s me, Ralph. Shhhh. Q*Bert is shocked to see Ralph. Ralph flips the visor bac down. He heads for the Hero’s Duty entrance. Q*Bert watches after him.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: LITWAK’S FAMILY FUN CENTER — MORNING The sun is up over Litwak’s. Litwak lights up the OPEN si

dialogues.speaker: LITWAK
dialogues.text: Morning kids, come on in. Good to see you, good to see you...you too, little fellow.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. HERO’S DUTY, TRAM STATION A high-speed shuttle sweeps up to a stop. The doors open. smiling Ralph and a few other soldiers run out. MUSIC STA Ralph looks around in awe.

dialogues.speaker: GAME ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Quarter alert. Quarter alert.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Ooh, sweet golden medal. Ralph follows the other soldiers. QUARTERS GO INTO A MACHINE. A MOPPET GIRL picks up the gun in front of the Hero’s Dut console.

dialogues.speaker: GAME ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: On a planet with no name. A top secret experiment has gone horribly wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. HERO’S DUTY, DARK HULL — DAY It’s chock full of soldiers. Ralph joins them.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Come on now, hustle up. Clock is ticking. Let’s go.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Rootin’, tootin’, ready for shootin’! Just then, SERGEANT TAMORA JEAN CALHOUN steps up before h men.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN
dialogues.text: Alright, now listen up ‘cause I’m only gonna say this once. Fear is a four letter word, ladies. If you wanna go pee-pee in your big boy slacks, keep it to yourself! It’s make-your-mamas-—proud time!

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: I love my momma!

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER 2
dialogues.text: Heads up! First-Person Shooter coming through. Soldiers make way for a rinky-dink robot with a flat-scre head that displays the count-down to game play. Stiff mechanical arms hold a gun. The wheels are wobbly to simu walking. Meet the FIRST-PERSON SHOOTER (“FPS”).

dialogues.speaker: GAME ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Game play in 3...2....

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN
dialogues.text: We are humanity’s last hope. Our mission: destroy all cy-bugs. Ralph shoves his way to the front, right behind the FPS.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You ready rookie? Let’s find out. The door opens and the view is vicious! The wind is wild. The terrain is sharp and twisted. Giant BUGS fly towards them. They’re part machine, part nature, with razor-sharp pincers, thrashing metal teeth and laser wings. A 99-story caustic building rises up out of the twisted ground behind them.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: (terrified) Sweet Mother Hubbard. Ralph is pushed out of the hub with the other soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No! Oh no no no, wait a second! Ahhh!

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN
dialogues.text: Cy-bug, twelve o’clock. Take it, newbie. As soldiers start killing bugs, Ralph runs around in a pa

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Oh no, wait, wait, wait! He raises his gun and shoots randomly.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN
dialogues.text: Watch it, Rookie! These monsters are what they eat. A cy-bug grabs Ralph’s gun out of his hands and eats it.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: My gun! Hey give that back. The cy-bug’s arm MORPHS into a gun. It starts shooting. R SCREAMS and runs away.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN
dialogues.text: (to the FPS) Shoot the eggs before they hatch! A Cy-bug lays a bunch of eggs in front of Ralph.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Eww. There’s something coming out of their bottoms. OUT IN THE ARCADE: The moppet girl looks confused. Calhou steps into frame, grabs Ralph, and throws him off-screen.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN
dialogues.text: Markowski! Get back in formation. BACK INSIDE HERO’S DUTY: Calhoun gets back on script.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All right people, the kitten whispers and tickle fights stop (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: now, the entrance to the lab is straight ahead. Ralph peeks up from behind a rock, looks at the building.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: I‘1l meet you guys inside. Sanctuary! Sanctuary! He runs for the building.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN
dialogues.text: No! As soon as he crosses the bridge, he sets off a sensors. lab doors fly open and a bigger swarm of cy-bugs pours ou Ralph runs up to the FPS, banging his head on the screen. pleads to the screen.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Abhhhhh! Ah! I thought this was going to be like Centipede! When did video games become so violent and scary? OUTSIDE THE GAME: The gamer sees his face pressed up agai the screen as he blubbers.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Save me! Get me outta here! BACK INSIDE THE GAME: Ralph uses the FPS droid as a shiel

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Take her! OUTSIDE THE GAME: The gamer watches the camera angle whip to the jaws of a giant cy-bug, then flip down as if the F has fallen dead.

dialogues.speaker: GAME VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Game over. The “GAME OVER” flashes on the screen. The girl slams the into its holder and marches away.

dialogues.speaker: MOPPET GIRL
dialogues.text: What a rip-off. BACK INSIDE HERO’S DUTY: Ralph grapples with the cy-bug w tries to eat him.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Get off me! It’s game over. Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER 1
dialogues.text: Cease fire. Cease fire! A beacon light suddenly shines through the center of the building and out the top. The cy-bug suddenly stops attacking Ralph. It turns to th light, charmed by it. It flies into the light and is zapp into oblivion, along with all the other bugs.

dialogues.speaker: GAME VOICE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Return to start positions. Return to start positions. The FPS robot rises back towards vertical. Ralph dusts hi off.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Here, let me help you. Sorry about that, I just-- Annoyed, its mechanical arms swat Ralph away. It rolls of

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, yeah, you must be upset. Calhoun bounds towards Ralph.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN
dialogues.text: Markowski!

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Who? Oh, yeah, me, I’m Markowski. Ralph stands at attention, chin raised, to avoid detectio Calhoun CLOCKS his helmet with the butt of her gun. RALPH (CONT’D) Ow!

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN
dialogues.text: What’s the first rule of Hero’s Duty?

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: .--No cuts, no butts, no coconuts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She clocks him again.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN
dialogues.text: Never interfere with the first person shooter. Our job is to get the gamers to the top of that building so they can get a medal, and that’s it. So stick to the program, soldier!

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Right, right, aye aye!

dialogues.speaker: GAME ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Quarter alert. Quarter alert.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN
dialogues.text: (walking away) All right, pussy willows, back to start positions!

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Yeah, right. No way I’m going through that again.... so that’s where they keep the medal, huh? He looks up at the formidable building.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: LITWAK’S ARCADE The moppet that had been playing Hero’s Duty now walks up a cheerful racing game called SUGAR RUSH. The marquee advertises: “New Racers Daily” and “Build your own kart.” BIG KIDS are playing it.

dialogues.speaker: MOPPET
dialogues.text: New racers daily, sweet... I got next game. The moppet goes to put a quarter on the console. The Big slides her quarter off with a whole roll of quarters.

dialogues.speaker: BIG KID ONE
dialogues.text: Go away, kid. We’re gonna play all nine of today’s racers.

dialogues.speaker: BIG KID TWO
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: MOPPET
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Moppet sighs, goes over to Fix-It Felix, Jr. instead. INSIDE NICELAND: The intro music plays. Nicelanders take their positions. But Ralph does not. A quote bubble pops where he should be, reading: I’M GONNA WRECK IT! BACK ON THE MOPPET: She looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: MOPPET GIRL
dialogues.text: Where’s the wrecking guy? INSIDE NICELAND: The Nicelanders start to panic.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Where’s Ralph? He should be wrecking the building.

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: Shhh. Stick with the program.

dialogues.speaker: NICELANDERS
dialogues.text: Fix it, Felix!

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: (jumping on screen) I can fix it! He GASPS in shock to see there’s no Ralph and nothing to but quickly recovers and smiles for the gamer.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (through gritted teeth) Ralph. Quarter alert. Game on. The Moppet Girl makes Felix bounce up the building.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Do something, Felix.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Just act natural. I'll fix it. BACK ON THE MOPPET: She freaks as the joystick moves on i own as Felix climbs down the building and runs off screen INSIDE NICELAND: Felix climbs Ralph’s garbage pile. Ralph not there. Felix’s reassuring face turns to panic.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my land. Where is he? BACK ON THE MOPPET: She’s fed up.

dialogues.speaker: MOPPET GIRL
dialogues.text: Mr. Litwak!

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITWAK
dialogues.text: What’s the trouble, sweetheart?

dialogues.speaker: MOPPET GIRL
dialogues.text: The game’s busted. Mr. Litwak takes a look. He can see the Nicelanders and F panicking on screen and hears nonsensical computer chatte

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITWAK
dialogues.text: Whoa boy, looks like the game’s gone cuckoo...like my Nana. (to the moppet) Sorry, sweetie. Here’s your quarter back. He gives her back a quarter.

dialogues.speaker: MOPPET
dialogues.text: But what about the game?

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITWAK
dialogues.text: I’'1ll have someone look at it tomorrow. But if he can’t fix it, it might be time to put ol’ Ralph and Felix out to pasture...like my Nana. Litwak hangs an OUT OF ORDER sign on the screen. INSIDE NICELAND: The Nicelanders run out of the building watch in horror as the sign eclipses the arcade light.

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, we are out of order!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Sweet Mercy! Without Ralph, we're doomed.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: They’re gonna pull our plug!

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: (forced positivity) Okay everybody calm down. Ralph probably fell asleep in the washroom of Tapper’s again. Just then, a light approaches through the cord.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (relieved) See? There he is now. 30 The push-cart arrives, cranked by Q*Bert, not Ralph.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why it’s Q*Bert. What brings you here, neighbor?

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: What’s he saying, Felix?

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Stand by, my Q*Bertese is a little rusty. (in bad Q*Bertese)

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: (in bad Q*Bertese)

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Ralph’s gone Turbo? RALPH'S STRAINED, GROWLING FACE.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Pull back to reveal, he’s still in Hero’s Duty. He’s forg the armor and he’s climbing the building. Ralph reaches the top. He peers in the window, A sea of eggs leads to a chamber in the middle Inside the chamber floats the Medal of Heroes.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Oooh, shiny. DOWN BELOW: Soldiers return to Start Position. sees: of the room.

dialogues.speaker: GAME VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Attention, the arcade is now closed.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER 1
dialogues.text: Did you get a load of Markowski? Calhoun stops, squints, sniffs. She raises her hand, quie her troops.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN
dialogues.text: Shut your chew holes. (to herself) Cy-bug. We hear a BLING. BLING. Felix steps out of the shadows. Calhoun reels around starts firing--

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Taste it! Soldiers open fire on Felix, too. He springs into action, bouncing, dodging bullets and laser beams. BLING. BLING. Calhoun finally tackles him, straddles him and pins him d

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Slick tiddly-winking, pint-size. She drives her gun’s muzzle into his face.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: I’m Fix-It Felix Jr., ma’am, from the game Fix-It Felix, Jr. From the low angle, looking up at her. FELIX (CONT’D) Jiminy-jaminy.... Look at that high definition. Your face; it’s amazing!

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN
dialogues.text: Flattery don’t charge these batteries, civilian. She lets him up.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now state your business.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Oh. I’m looking for my colleague, Wreck-It Ralph.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN
dialogues.text: Never heard of him....

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Well Q*Bert saw him come in here.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN
dialogues.text: Impossible. Nothing gets past me. A CRASH is heard from above.

dialogues.speaker: KOHUT
dialogues.text: That came from the tower! They look and see Ralph’s shadow on the top floor made gi by the beacon light. ON THE TOP FLOOR OF THE LAB: Ralph punches the window, br it, and steps in. He does his most careful TIP-TOE across sea of eggs.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Nice little eggs... excuse me... He climbs the steps up to the chamber, triggering a giant hologram head to appear.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL HOLOGRAM
dialogues.text: Congratulations soldier. It is my honor to bestow upon you the Medal of Heroes.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: (in awe) Wow. The medal floats down to him. As it does, we see... RALPH'S PENTHOUSE PARTY — VISION -Ralph is on the dance floor surrounded by Nicelanders do the Wreck-it Ralph dance. -Mary wheels out a cake with a handsome Ralph on top, wea his Medal of Heroes and being hugged by the Nicelander figurines. -Gene is outside in the brick pile looking longingly up a the party through binoculars. He cries. BACK TO REALITY: The medal lands around Ralph’s neck.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No way. Ho-ho-ho. Wow!

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL HOLOGRAM
dialogues.text: Ten hut! History will long revere your courage and sacrifice. More holograms of space Colonels and Generals surround hi Heroic music plays. Ralph backs down the steps, smiling a waving to the holograms. GENERAL HOLOGRAM (CONT’D) You have etched in the rock of virtue, a legacy beyond compare.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Thank you. Thanks guys. At ease!

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL HOLOGRAM
dialogues.text: You are the universe’s greatest hero. CRACK! Ralph steps on an egg. SMASH! The egg shatters.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Oops. Aye-yai-yai. Ralph leans in for a closer look. The baby bug opens its cutely and then attacks. It attaches itself to Ralph’s fa

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: .--The living embodiment of all that this corps represents: Bravery, integrity, grace under pressure, and above all, dignity. RALPH (CONT’D) Ahhhhhmmmf fff! Ralph stumbles around, flies back and into one of the spa pods. A harness immediately locks him in place. The door slams shut.

dialogues.speaker: GAME ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Escape pod activated. The engine fires and then BOOM! The space pod bursts out the top of the building. INSIDE THE POD: Ralph struggles to pull the cy-bug off hi

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: (struggling) Get off my face! BACK OUTSIDE: The pod barrels down on Calhoun and Felix.

dialogues.speaker: KOHUT
dialogues.text: Incoming! The pod flies over the heads of Calhoun and Felix. As it passes by, Calhoun sees the cy-bug on Ralph’s face.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN
dialogues.text: Cy-bug.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Ralph! The pods flies out of the game into tunnel to Game Centra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph's pod blasts into the terminal, spiralling like an of-control bottle rocket off the floor and walls. Ralph t to pry the bug off of his face. POP! It lets go.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Ha ha! But then the bug starts to grow, fast.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh no! The space pod launches into the tunnel of another game. T blackness of the tunnel turns pink. Globs of pink goo col on the windshield. SHIP’S ROBOT VOICE Engine Failure. Engine Failure.

dialogues.speaker: AAAAAAAAAHHHHHHHHH
dialogues.text: The space pod CRASH LANDS in...

dialogues.speaker: A CANDY WORLD
dialogues.text: It destroys a slice of countryside before stopping at the edge of a cliff. Ralph and the cy-bug slam against the da Something beeps. It’s the EJECT button!

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Uh-oh. Whoaaaaaaaa!!! Ralph and the cy-bug catapult out of the ship. Ralph land the top of a tree. The cy-bug continues on and slams into nearby tree. It falls into a taffy pool and sinks as if d

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sayonara, sucker! From his vantage point Ralph can see a candy race track a bunch of dessert go-karts whizzing by. A giant sign glist SUGAR RUSH.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sugar Rush? Oh no, this is that candy go-kart game over by the Whack-A-Mole. I got to get out of here. He wipes the stickiness off on his shirt and realizes tha his medal is gone.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No! No-no-no-no-no-NO! My medal! He spots the medal dangling from the highest branch of a peppermint tree. Ralph quickly climbs down the tree as it shakes from his weight.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: THE MEDAL IN THE PEPPERMINT TREE — MOMENTS LATER The tree is surrounded by a bubbling taffy pool. Ralph teeters across some wobbly gum drops floating in the pool grabs the tree and climbs, eyes on the medal.

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hi mister!

dialogues.speaker: AHHH
dialogues.text: He looks up, terrified. But it’s only VANELLOPE VON SCHWE a 9-year-old girl, looking down from a branch above him.

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: Hello!

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Man! You scared me, kid! I nearly soiled myself!

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: What’s your name?

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Ralph, Wreck-it Ralph.

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: You’re not from here, are you?

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: No, well, yeah, I mean not from right in this area. But I’m just doing some work here.

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: What kind of work? He continues climbing.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Some routine candy-tree trimming. You probably want to stand back. In fact, this whole area is technically closed while we’re trimmin’ so--

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: Who’s we?

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Candy-tree department. He climbs higher.

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: Ah. Where is everybody else?

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Oh, it’s just me, today.

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: So, you just meant like the royal we?

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Yup. That’s right. Vanellope springs up to a branch by his face and hangs up down.

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: Are you a hobo?

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: No, I am not a hobo. But I am busy, so you go, go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He climbs

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: What’s that? I didn’t hear you. Your breath is so bad, it made my ears numb.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Listen, I try to be nice--

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: (mimicking him) I try to be nice.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: You're mimicking me.

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: (still mimicking) You're mimicking me.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Okay, that is rude, and this conversation is over. on.

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: (still mimicking) That is rude and this conversation is....hahaha. (watching him) I wouldn't grab that branch if I were you. It’s a double stripe.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: I’m from the candy-tree department. I know exactly-- He grabs the branch. DING! SNAP. Ralph Falls. RALPH (CONT’D)

dialogues.speaker: --WHOA
dialogues.text: He barely manages to catch a lower branch with one hand.

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: Double stripes break, ga-doi. Hey, why are your hands so freakishly big?

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Uh, I dunno. Why are you so freakishly annoying?

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: Well, why are you so freakishly-- Just then, she notices the glistening medal.

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sweet mother of monkey milk! A gold coin!

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Don’t even think about it. That is mine.

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: Race you for it! Vanellope moves like a monkey up the branches. Ralph foll

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: I don’t have to race you for it, because it’s mine. Grabs a double stripe. DING! It BREAKS!

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: Double stripe! Vanellope makes it to the top and grabs the medal.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Come back here! Give it back, give it, give it!

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: The winner! Whoa! Ralph grabs the branch she’s on and flings her off. She d the medal. He catches it. She dives for it, misses. Ralph lands on a double-stripe. DING! VANELLOPE (CONT’D) Double stripe! CRACK. He falls. The medal goes flying again.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Aahhh! Nooooooo! He grabs the bottom branch and hangs inches above the BUBBLING taffy. Vanellope snags the medal.

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hops off the tree to the ground, safely beyond the ta

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Look, wait. Let me talk to you for one second. Here’s the thing, I’m not from the candy tree department.

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: Lying to a child. Shame on you, Ralph.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: But I wasn’t lying about the medal. That is my medal. That’s why I was climbing the tree. It’s mine. It’s precious to me. Vanellope polishes the medal, admiring it.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That thing’s my ticket to a better life.

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: Yeah, well now it’s my ticket. Vanellope glitches.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: What the...?

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: See ya, chump. She runs off.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Come back! I’11 find you! I will find you! Ralph hears a DING. He looks up. CRACK!

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Double stripe! Ralph falls into the gooey taffy pool! He bubbles up, loo like a taffy beast.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Nowhere to hide! He disappears back beneath the sticky surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surge Protector shows Felix and Calhoun the damaged entra to Sugar Rush.

dialogues.speaker: SURGE PROTECTOR
dialogues.text: Yeah, he banged around in here like some kind of hot shot. Then he went barreling down there into that sweet, little game like a crazy person. Calhoun studies the entrance to Sugar Rush.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN
dialogues.text: Sugar Rush... (a steely Clint Eastwood- esque squint) Cy-Bugs‘1ll chew up that game faster than a chicken hawk in a coop of crippled roosters.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: (following close behind) Uh. What was that now? She turns on him-- dead serious.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN
dialogues.text: What’re you, thick? There was a Cy- Bug on that shuttle. (off his confused look) Do you even know what a Cy-Bug IS?

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: I can’t say that I do, ma’am.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN
dialogues.text: (like talking to a child) Cy-Bugs are like a virus. They don’t know they’re in a game. All they know is eat, kill, multiply. Without a beacon to stop them, they’11l consume Sugar Rush. But do you think they’1l stop there?

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN
dialogues.text: WRONG! Viruses do not stop! She stands up straight and majestic and looks over Game Central to all the tunnels leading to so many games.  WRECK-IT RALPH 4l

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Once those Cy-Bugs finish off Sugar Rush, they'll invade every other game until this arcade is nothing but a smoking husk of forgotten dreams. (resolute) Kohut! My cruiser. Kohut hands her what looks like a folded surf board. Calh heads down the steps to the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: (to Kohut) Sheepers. Is she always this intense?

dialogues.speaker: KOHUT
dialogues.text: It’s not her fault. She’s programmed with the most tragic back story ever. The one day she didn’t do a perimeter check... her wedding day. Calhoun stares down the dark tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: SMASH CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. CHURCH: Calhoun and an incredibly handsome soldier, BRAD, are about to exchange vows at the altar. Just then giant cy-bug crashes through the stained-glass window and CHOMPS down on the groom. Calhoun pulls out her automatic weapons and starts shooting through RAGING WAILS.

dialogues.speaker: SMASH CUT TO
dialogues.text: CALHOUN: She tries to shake it off. Felix hurries up to her in the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Wait, Ma’am! I’m going with you!

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN
dialogues.text: Like fun you are, short stack. You die outside your game you don’t regenerate.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Well neither do you, ma’am. Now, it is my job to fix what Ralph wrecks. And I cannot ask you to risk your life cleaning up his mess. No flex (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: FELIX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: on this one, ma‘am. I am coming along with you. She gives him a hard look, then scoots aside on her hover board, snaps, and points behind her on the board. He flip onto it. And off they go...

dialogues.speaker: THE SUGAR RUSH RACE TRACK
dialogues.text: The stands are full. Racers zip up to the starting line i their go-karts. Bright royal music plays.

dialogues.speaker: SOUR BILL
dialogues.text: (flat, sad voice) Citizens of Sugar Rush... BENEATH THE STANDS: Vanellope sneaks up, pushing a tarp- covered kart. She peeks her head out, the Medal of Heroes clenched between her teeth.

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: Just in time!

dialogues.speaker: SOUR BILL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: .--all hail our rightful ruler, King Candy. Up in the tallest box, a curtain opens and KING CANDY -- his Ed-Wynn-like mug and style -- jumps out.

dialogues.speaker: KING CANDY
dialogues.text: Hello my loyal subjects! Ha ha! Have some candy! King Candy throws handfuls of candy into the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: KING CANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thank you for that stirring introduction, Sour Bill

dialogues.speaker: SOUR BILL
dialogues.text: Mmm hmm.

dialogues.speaker: KING CANDY
dialogues.text: And thank you to today’s avatars. It was a wonderful day, it was. But now the arcade is closed, so it’s time to wipe the slate clean and race to decide our new roster. Huge cheers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE TRACK: We scan across the racers standing proud in their candy racing gear as King Candy explains the rules.

dialogues.speaker: KING CANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The first nine racers across that finish line will represent Sugar Rush as tomorrow’s Avatars.

dialogues.speaker: KING CANDY
dialogues.text: Yes, okay. Calm down. Listen, this event is pay-to-play. We all know this. The fee to compete is one gold coin from your previous winnings; if you’ve ever won, which I have. Let me go first. King Candy pulls a lever and a rainbow sweeps across the starting line. King Candy throws his gold coin into the a It’s caught on a rainbow slide and swept into a giant pot King Candy’s name appears on a CONTESTANT board.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: King Candy! King Candy leaps into the air with a flourish and poses. crowd goes wild! The first racer, a strawberry-pink, go-getter, tosses up coin. We follow it and watch it land in the pot, where it turns into game code and then disappears into an abyss.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Taffyta Muttonfudge! Taffyta does her signature leap and pose in the air and g the fans her catch-phrase.

dialogues.speaker: TAFFYTA
dialogues.text: Stay sweet! More kids throw in their coins as Vanellope pushes her covered kart to the starting line.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Adorabeezle Winterpop! Gloyd Orangeboar! Vanellope scurries up to the back of the line.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Crumbelina Di Caramello!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON RALPH: Ralph, covered in taffy, trudges his way toward the race track.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Stealer. Catch that brat. BACK AT THE TRACK: Racers continue throwing their coins i the pot.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Minty Zaki! Snowanna Rainbeaux! Rancis Fluggerbutter! Jubileena Bing-Bing! Swizzle Malarkey! Candlehead! It’s Vanellope’s turn. She kisses the medal and throws it It’s caught by the rainbow, rims around the pot before dropping in. The pot glitches. The medal swirls inside it turns into game code, and disappears into the abyss.

dialogues.speaker: KING CANDY
dialogues.text: (covering the mic) Sour Bill, who’s that last one? The board glitches and then a new racer appears on it: VANELLOPE VON SCHWEETZ. The crowd gasps in horror.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Vanellope Von Schweetz!

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: Yippee! I’m in the race!

dialogues.speaker: KING CANDY
dialogues.text: Vanellope?! Taffyta rips the tarp off of Vanellope’s kart, revealing sad kart made from recycled junk with the name “Lickity Split” written on the side.

dialogues.speaker: TAFFYTA
dialogues.text: The glitch! The crowd starts to panic.

dialogues.speaker: KING CANDY
dialogues.text: Now, now. Everything is all right. (panicking) Security! Two donut cops, WYNNCHEL and DUNCAN, come running in.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: Come here, kid.

dialogues.speaker: WYNNCHEL
dialogues.text: We're not going to hurt you, you little freak. Vanellope makes a break for it.

dialogues.speaker: WYNNCHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get back here!

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: Slow down! Just then a taffy-covered Ralph -- twigs and candy stuck him -- comes barrelling onto the track, looking like a creature from the taffy lagoon.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: (pointing at her) YOU! Give me back my medal right now.

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: Oh boy.

dialogues.speaker: KING CANDY
dialogues.text: What is that? Ralph chases Vanellope.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Get back here. Vanellope slips under a spectator’s box. Ralph lifts up t box, revealing her.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nowhere to hide!

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: Whoa! She scurries back under the next box. Ralph follows her, tipping box after box. Spectators scat

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Get out of my way!

dialogues.speaker: KING CANDY
dialogues.text: Careful! What are you doing?! Vanellope runs out from under then stands. Ralph follows. slams into a giant cupcake, water tower. It tips.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: np rooktng up) Huh? The giant cupcake falls onto him. His taffy-covered head out the top. He tips over.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can't move.

dialogues.speaker: WYNNCHEL
dialogues.text: Now we got him. The donut cops rush up to a helpless Ralph -- who points where Vanellope went and mumble-yells.

dialogues.speaker: OH GOOD, THE COPS. SHE WEN DAAAWAY
dialogues.text: They ignore him and knock him with their batons.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: Hold still.

dialogues.speaker: WYNNCHEL
dialogues.text: Take that.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Hmmmmay! What’re you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: KING CANDY
dialogues.text: (into his microphone) Okay folks. Calm down! Everything's all right. The monster's been caught. We’ll repair all the damage. Don’t worry, we will have our race before the arcade opens.

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: And I’m in it. Vanellope hops into her kart and pedals off.

dialogues.speaker: TAFFYTA
dialogues.text: (to the other racers) There’s no way that I am racing with a glitch. Rancis, Candlehead, come on. She and the racers hop in their cars and drive off.

dialogues.speaker: KING CANDY
dialogues.text: Sour Bill, that glitch cannot be allowed to race. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: KING CANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (point down to Ralph) And bring that THING to my castle. Wynnchel switches to using a taser on Ralph.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: She took my me-- Aaaahhhhhh!!!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. KING’S CANDY CASTLE OREO GUARDS march and chant outside a grand candy palace.

dialogues.speaker: OREO GUARDS
dialogues.text: (chanting) O-re-o. O-ree-o. O-re-o. O-ree-o. INT. KING’S CANDY CASTLE The donut police roll the Ralph cupcake/taffy ball into a frilly throne room. King Candy drives his kart right into room and backs it into his THRONE parking spot.

dialogues.speaker: KING CANDY
dialogues.text: Sour Bill, de-taffify this monster so we can see what we’re up against here.

dialogues.speaker: SOUR BILL
dialogues.text: Mmmm-kay. Sour Bill pulls off a giant glob of taffy, exposing Ralph face and head.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Waaahhhhhh!

dialogues.speaker: KING CANDY
dialogues.text: Milk my duds, it’s Wreck-it Ralph?!

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: (getting his bearings) Yeah. Who are you, the guy that makes the donuts?

dialogues.speaker: KING CANDY
dialogues.text: Please. No, I’m King Candy.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: I see you’re a fan of pink.

dialogues.speaker: KING CANDY
dialogues.text: Salmon. Salmon. That’s obviously sal-- What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Look, you're candiness, this is just a big misunderstanding. Just get me out of this cupcake, I’‘1l get my medal, and I’1l be outta your way.

dialogues.speaker: KING CANDY
dialogues.text: YOUR medal? Bad guys don’t win medals.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Well, this one did. I earned it over in Hero’s Duty.

dialogues.speaker: KING CANDY
dialogues.text: You game-jumped? Ralph, you’re not going Turbo are you?

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: What? No, no no.

dialogues.speaker: KING CANDY
dialogues.text: Because if you think you can come in here to my kingdom and take over my game, you’ve got another thing coming.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Easy your puffiness. It’s not my fault one of your children of the candy corn stole my medal!

dialogues.speaker: KING CANDY
dialogues.text: Children of the candy corn? Who? (realizing, GASP) The glitch! The coin she used to buy her way into the race, that was your medal?

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: She did what...? I need that back!

dialogues.speaker: KING CANDY
dialogues.text: Well, I’m afraid I can’t help you. It’s gone, it’s nothing but code now. And it’1ll stay that way until someone wins the cup at the end of the race.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Well, maybe I’11 just have to have a little talk with the winner then.

dialogues.speaker: KING CANDY
dialogues.text: Is that a threat I smell-- beyond the halitosis you so obviously suffer from?

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Listen Nillie Wafer, I’m not leaving without my medal.

dialogues.speaker: KING CANDY
dialogues.text: Yes, you are. Wynnchel, Duncan, get him out of that cupcake and on the first train back home. And if I ever see you here again, Wreck-it Ralph, I‘’1l lock you in my fungeon.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Fungeon?

dialogues.speaker: KING CANDY
dialogues.text: Fun Dungeon. It’s a play on words.... Nevermind. Now, I’ve got a glitch to deal with, thanks to you. Goodbye Wreck-it Ralph. It hasn’t been a pleasure. King Candy hops into his kart and drives out of the room. Wynnchel knocks on the cupcake.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: This thing’s hard as a rock.

dialogues.speaker: WYNNCHEL
dialogues.text: I can see that. Get the tools.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: What tools? Wynnchel hits Ralph with the baton.

dialogues.speaker: WYNNCHEL
dialogues.text: Quiet, you. Duncan goes over to a chest, pulls out a chain-saw, and r it up.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: What? No! Ah! Stay away from me!

dialogues.speaker: WYNNCHEL
dialogues.text: Hey, take it easy, big boy. Ralph flails. He rolls back onto his feet and starts hobb towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: He’s getting away! The Oreo guards block his way, shouting “Oreo.” He turns eyes two giant windows.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE DOUBLE CASTLE WINDOWS
dialogues.text: Ralph and the cupcake burst through the wall and fall.

dialogues.speaker: BACK INSIDE THE CASTLE
dialogues.text: Wynnchel and Duncan run to the window. They look down and the smashed cupcake on the ground and Ralph running away.

dialogues.speaker: WYNNCHEL
dialogues.text: Quick, call out the devil dogs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL DOGS on leashes bound through the trees and down th ravine. They stop by a chocolate stream. They lose the sc and run off down river. A pixie stick, poking out of the stream, moves. Ralph bre the surface.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Argh... I hate chocolate. (scrambling to the shore) Got to get my medal back. He hears the ROAR of engines. Sees a bunch of racers spee on nearby road.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The pot goes to the winning racer. He runs after them.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, kids! Can I talk to you for a second? He just misses them, as they disappear around the bend an approach Vanellope, who is working on her handmade kart. up on a jacks. The racers sweep in and surround her. She pushes away any evidence of fear and stands tall to meet them.

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: Hello, fellow racers! Ralph peeks over the hill.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: It’s that little crumbsnatcher.

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: Taffyta, Rancis, you’re looking well. Came by to check out the competition, huh? Well, here it is, The Lickity Split. unimpressed.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Jeesh. Looks like she built it herself. BACK ON THE KIDS: Taffyta gets out of her kart and approa Vanellope.

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: Built it myself. Fastest pedal- power west of the Whack-A-Mole. Check her out. Vanellope hops in her kart and starts pedalling. The gear catch and spin.

dialogues.speaker: TAFFYTA
dialogues.text: Oh, Vanellope, it’s so...you. But you have to back out of the race, yeah. Vanellope gets out of her kart and approaches Taffyta.

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: Oh, no I don’t, because I paid my fee. I’m on the board. So, yeah, I’m definitely racing.

dialogues.speaker: TAFFYTA
dialogues.text: Well, King Candy says glitches can’t race.

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: I’m not a glitch, Taffyta. (she glitches) I've just got Pixlexia, okay? Ignoring her, Taffyta walks over to Vanellope’s kart.

dialogues.speaker: TAFFYTA
dialogues.text: The rules are there for a reason, Vanellope. To protect us. (getting in Vanellope’s kart) Say I’m you. I’m in my weird little car, and I’m driving, and I actually feel kinda cool for once. And then, all of a sudden, oh no! I'm gl-gl-gl-gl-itching! Taffyta shudders and then rips the steering wheel right o

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: TAFFYTA
dialogues.text: See? You're an accident just waiting to happen.

dialogues.speaker: JUBILEENA
dialogues.text: Oh no, I glitched, too. Jubileena goes over to the kart, flails and crashes into ripping off the brake. Vanellope rushes over to her kart, other racers get in her way and block her. ON RALPH: Disturbed by what he’s seeing.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Uncool. BACK ON THE KIDS: The other racers tear apart the kart.

dialogues.speaker: VARIOUS RACERS
dialogues.text: Oh no, I glitched. I glitched. Look out, I’m glitching.

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: Stop. You’re breaking it! No! Please. Vanellope grabs Taffyta and spins her around to face her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VANELLOPE (CONT’D) I just want to race like you guys.

dialogues.speaker: TAFFYTA
dialogues.text: You'll never be a racer, because you're a glitch...and that’s all you'll ever be. Taffyta pushes Vanellope, who goes flying back, and lands SPLAT in the mud. ON RALPH: That’s the last straw; he jumps up.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Hey! Leave her alone! He runs down the hill, flails his arms, and throws mud at kids. They SCREAM in terror.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Scram, you rotten little cavities, before I throw YOU in the mud! The racers drive off. Ralph puffs up. He turns to Vanello She wipes away tears, while sifting through the wreckage her kart.

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: What are YOU looking at?

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: You're welcome, you rotten little thief.

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: I’m not a thief. I just borrowed your stupid coin. I was gonna give it back to you as soon as I won the race.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: It’s not a coin. It is a medal.

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: Coin. Medal. Just go back to your own dumb game and win another one.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: I can’t. I didn’t win it in my game. I won it in Hero’s Duty.

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: Hero’s Doodie?! Ha!

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: It’s not that kind of duty.

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: I bet you really gotta watch where you step in a game called Hero’s Doodie. What did you win a medal for? Wiping? I hope you washed your hands after you handled that medal.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Listen.

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: Wait. One more. One more: why did the hero flush the toilet? VANELLOPE (CONT’D) Say why...

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Why.

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: Because it was his doodie.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: How dare you insult Hero's Duty, you little guttersnipe! I earned that medal, and you better get it back for me, toot-sweet, sister!

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: Well, unless you’ve got a go-kart hidden in the fat folds of your neck, I can’t help you. Ralph makes like he wants to crush her, but forces himsel smash a nearby candy tree instead. He then punches a gian jawbreaker. It doesn’t so much as crack. He tries again. Nothing. Incensed, he pounds on it-- temper-tantrum style VANELLOPE (CONT’D) What a moron. (calling to Ralph) Hey genius, it’s a jawbreaker! You’re never gonna break-- (as he breaks it) ..-that...? That gives her an idea.

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hmmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph plops down on a rock, out of breath. Vanellope come over and leans against a nearby jawbreaker. VANELLOPE (CONT’D) Enjoy your little tantrum, diaper baby?

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Leave me alone.

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: Look, you want that medal, right? And I want to race. So, here’s what I'm thinking; you help me get a new kart, a real kart, and I’1l win the race and get you back your medal.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: You want me to help you?

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: All you got to do is break something for me. Come on, what do you say, friend? She holds out a hand. He doesn’t take it right away.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: We are not friends.

dialogues.speaker: VANELLOPE
dialogues.text: Ah come on, pal. You son of a gun. Come on buddy, let’s shake on it. Come on chumbo. Ralph, my man. My main man. Hey, my arm’s getting tired. We have a deal or not?

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: You better win. He takes her little hand, and they shake on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix and Calhoun get a bird’s eye view of Ralph’s wrecka

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN
dialogues.text: I'll say this much, they don’t call your friend Wreck-It for nothing. There’s the shuttle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lands the cruiser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calhoun does a military run up to the ship, gun raised. S circles it, checks the cockpit. Felix approaches cautiously.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Is he in there?

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN
dialogues.text: Nope. Lucky for him, otherwise I would have slapped his corpse.... No cy-bug either. She pulls out her tri-quarter bug sensor and starts scann

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Got to find it before it lays its filthy eggs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calhoun and Felix pass the pit. She’s getting a faint sig on the sensor. It scrambles. She smacks it. It scrambles more.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN
dialogues.text: (with disgust) Argh. This atmosphere is full of sugar particles, and it’s jamming my Sensor with funny fudge. They walk on.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So, what is it with this Wreck-it joker? Why’d he go AWOL?

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: I wish I knew, ma’am. He was acting all squirrelly last night-- going on about cake and medals. (distraught) But I never thought he’d go Turbo.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN
dialogues.text: Go Turbo...?

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: That's right, guys just got plugged in. Well, back when the arcade first opened...

dialogues.speaker: FADE TO
dialogues.text: INT. LITWAK’S ARCADE, EARLY 80S - FLASHBACK Simpler days. 80s music. 80s kids play classic games -- F PAC MAN, and an 8-bit racing game called TURBO TIME. We m TURBO -- basically a giant smiley face in a generic car, racing on a generic road.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: «+. Turbo Time was by far the most popular game. Turbo crosses the finish line and gives us a giant thumbs

dialogues.speaker: FELIX, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And Turbo-- well, he loved the attention. Turbo takes the first-place spot on a podium. He blocks t second-place racer down with a wave of his trophy and blo the third-place racer from view with his Turbo thumbs-up.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So when RoadBlasters got plugged in and stole Turbo’s thunder, boy was he jealous... RoadBlasters is wheeled in. Kids abandon Turbo Time to pl it. TURBO is left mid-game. He stops and looks across the arcade to Pole Position. His big smile turns to a frown.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So jealous that abandoned his game... POWER STRIP: We watch the little Turbo dots cross the pow cord from his game to RoadBlasters.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -..and tried to take over the new one. ROADBLASTERS — SHORT TIME LATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A frustrated kid tries to play RoadBlasters, but the scre is in chaos -- an 8-bit Turbo glitches all over the track causing the kid to crash his car.

dialogues.speaker: KID 1
dialogues.text: Is that-- that looks like Turbo!

dialogues.speaker: KID 2
dialogues.text: Aw what’s Turbo doing in this game? (crashing) Aw c’mon!

dialogues.speaker: KID 1
dialogues.text: Mr. Litwak!

dialogues.speaker: FELIX, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Turbo ended up putting both games and himself out of order, for good. A WORKER wheels out both Turbo Time and Pole Position. BACK ON CALHOUN AND FELIX: Calhoun shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN
dialogues.text: The selfish man is like a mangy dog chasing a cautionary tale. They step onto a fallen peppermint tree acting as a bridg over a ravine.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: I know, right? That's why I have to get Ralph home, or the same thing’s gonna happen to my game. DING! DING! The entire tree is double stripe. It blinks.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Huh? The tree disappears. They fall into a pit of chocolate powder.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN
dialogues.text: What is this? A sign reads: NESQUIK SAND.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nesquik Sand? They start sinking. Felix panics.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Quik sand?! I’11 hop out and grab you one of those vines! Calhoun stands calm, sizing up the situation. Felix flail he tries to hop out of the sand. But his usual “boing” is more like a “bllllrgh” as the sand swallows him.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can’t hop. I’m hopless! This is hopeless! We’re gonna drown here!

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN
dialogues.text: Stop thrashing! Stop moving-- you're making us sink faster! He’s still panicking. Calhoun slaps him in the face.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get a hold of yourself. He looks at her, shocked. Suddenly they hear GIGGLING. Th look up to see Laffy Taffy vines hanging from a tree. As vines giggle, they stretch and lower towards them.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Those vines. They’re Laffy Taffy. They’re attracted to whatever makes them laugh. Here, hit me again. She smacks him, lightly. The taffy vines retreat, disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s not funny enough. Harder. She hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN
dialogues.text: Look, you're a nice guy, I can’t--

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: (unusually forceful) No, ma’‘am! The arcade is depending on us. Now do your duty, that’s an order! She full on belts him. The taffy howls with laughter. He’ got a huge back eye.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Owwww! It’s working, hit me again!

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN
dialogues.text: Ooh, your eye.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: I can fix it. He hits his eye with the hammer. His black eye goes away.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now go-- ow! San Frantastic. WHAP! The vines howl. Felix smiles at her. He’s got teeth missing. He hammers his teeth. BLING! His teeth reappear.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Again! Ow! You mean business! Ow! Yikes on bikes! She hits. BLING. He fixes his face. She hits. BLING. He f his face. She hits. Bling. He fixes.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're... killing... them... Finally, the vines are within reach. He grabs hold, then pulls her into his arms.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hold on tight, m’lady. The vine sweeps them up and out of the quicksand. The wor slows down. Music swells. Calhoun looks up at Felix. For reason he looks strong-jawed and heroic. He smiles down o her. Man, she’s beautiful. There’s a real chemistry betwe them. They arrive on the tree branch. Calhoun notices that the Laffy Taffy are singing in a Dis esque choir and have formed a heart shape around them. Sh pulls out her gun and shoots at the vines.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUN
